section.heading: Incorporation by Reference of Poison Prevention Packaging Regulations.

para.text: All provisions of 16 Code of Federal Regulations, Part 1700, are incorporated by reference, except for the changes shown in §B of this regulation.
"Act" means Child Resistant Packaging of Dangerous Household Substances, Health-General Article, §§22-301 — 22-312, Annotated Code of Maryland.
"Commission" means the Maryland Department of Health.

"Dietary supplement" means a vitamin or mineral preparation, or both, offered in tablet, capsule, wafer, or other similar uniform unit form; in powder, granule, flake, or liquid form; or in the physical form of a conventional food but which is not a conventional food; and which purports or is represented to be for special dietary use by humans to supplement their diets by increasing the total dietary intake of one or more of the essential vitamins or minerals, or both.

annotations.annotation: Health-General Article, Title 22, Subtitle 3, Annotated Code of Maryland
Regulation .01 amended effective January 7, 1991 (17:26 Md. R. 2975)
